name: 陳匡正
objective: Trademark Act is formulated to safeguard trademark rights and consumers' interest, maintain fair competitions of markets, and facilitate normal development of industries and commerce. A trademark may be composed of a word, design, symbol, color, sound, three-dimensional shape or a combination thereof. A trademark as defined above shall be distinctive enough for relevant consumers of the goods or services to recognize it as identification to those goods or services and to differentiate such goods or services from those offered by others. A person who wishes to obtain trademark rights in order to distinguish its goods or services shall apply for trademark registration as provided under this Act. The discussion in the course covers theory and examples to enhance a deeper understanding of Trademark Act for the students.
schedule:
Week 1 (2023/2/20~2023/2/25) Case Studies of Trademark Use about Keyword Advertising (I)
Week 2 (2023/2/27~2023/3/4) Case Studies of Trademark Use about Keyword Advertising (II)
Week 3 (2023/3/6~2023/3/11) Case Studies of Trademark Use about Gift (I)
Week 4 (2023/3/13~2023/3/18) Case Studies of Trademark Use about Gift (II)
Week 5 (2023/3/20~2023/3/25) Case Studies about Judging Trademark Likelihood of Confusion (I)
Week 6 (2023/3/27~2023/4/1) Case Studies about Judging Trademark Likelihood of Confusion (II)
Week 7 (2023/4/3~2023/4/8) Case Studies of Descriptive Mark
Week 8 (2023/4/10~2023/4/15) Case Studies about Name Trademark and Personality Right Protection
Week 9 (2023/4/17~2023/4/22) A Lecture of Trademark Industrial Teacher
Week 10 (2023/4/24~2023/4/29) Case Studies about Protection of Well-Known Trademark 
Week 11 (2023/5/1~2023/5/6) Case Studies about Parallel Importation and Trademark Infringement
Week 12 (2023/5/8~2023/5/13) Case Studies about Trademark Exhaustion Doctrine and Parallel Importation of Genuine Goods
Week 13 (2023/5/15~2023/5/20) Case Studies about Trademark Bona Fide Use
Week 14 (2023/5/22~2023/5/27) Case Studies about Fair Use of Geographical Name Trademark; Case Studies about Judging Fair Use of Trademark Parody
Week 15 (2023/5/29~2023/6/3) Final Week/A Week's Classes Suspension
Week 16 (2023/6/5~2023/6/10) Final Project Report (I)
Week 17 (2023/6/12~2023/6/17) Final Project Report (II)
Week 18 (2023/6/19~2023/6/24) Summer Vacation
scorePolicy:
1.Class Case Presentation 20%
2.Final Project Report 60%
3.Class Attendance and Participation 20%
materials:
1.Cases of Intellectual Property and Commercial Court.
2.Chou-Fu Lin, Case Analyses of Trademark Law (Wu-Nan Book Inc., 2021).
3.Chao-Hua Chen & Min-Chuan Wang, Theories and Practices of Trademark Law (Angle Publishing Co. Ltd., 2021).
4.Kuang-Cheng Chen, A Study of Intellectual Property Law on Multiple Vision (Angle Publishing Co. Ltd., 2021).
5.Wen-Yin Chen, Trademark Law (San Min Book Co. Ltd., 2020).
6.Kuang-Cheng Chen, Systematic Research on Trademark Act: Formation, Bona Fide Use, and Infringement of Trademark (Angle Publishing Co. Ltd., 2023).
7.Kuang-Cheng Chen, Specific Research on Trademark Act: Trademark Use, Exhaustion Doctrine, and Likelihood of Confusion (Angle Publishing Co. Ltd., 2020).
8.Tu-Tsun Wang, Trademark Law (Wu-Nan Book Inc., 2012).
consultation: 1.E-mail of the Lecturer: kcschen@mail.ntut.edu.tw.2.Line Group Link:
remarks: ※Level 1 & 2 Epidemic Alert: Classes in Person.※Level 3 or Above Epidemic Alert: Distance Learning.●Teaching Method: Distance Learning through Microsoft Teams.●Grades:1.Class Case Presentation 20%2.Final Project Report 60%3.Class Attendance and Participation 20%
